newsitem.title: USA: Apple tries to recruit Kodak's Fisher-NY Times.
newsitem.headline: Apple tries to recruit Kodak's Fisher-NY Times.

text.p: Apple Computer advisor Steven Jobs has been trying unsuccessfully to persuade Eastman Kodak Chief Executive George Fisher to come to Apple, The New York Times said.
In Friday's edition, the paper cited an unnamed executive who knows both men as the source of the information.
Neither Jobs nor Fisher would comment for The Times' story.

Jobs, who co-founded Apple, returned to the company three weeks ago after the previous CEO departed. Though reports say he appears to be running the company, Jobs is reported to have told friends that he does not want the CEO position.

The Times said Jobs is also reportedly trying to recruit former board members of Apple and Next Inc, including a friend, Larry Ellison, the chairman of Oracle; John Warnock, chairman of Adobe Corp; and Daniel Case, an investment banker at Hambrecht & Quist, to fill open positions on the Apple board.
